span.span: All CFSD schools are closed for the remainder of the school year. Please visit our COVID-19 page for additional information.

br.strong: Sowing the Seeds of Deep Learning

div.p: How can a school garden project cultivate a love of poetry and art? Ms. Gibson's students show how they made learning bloom.

a.span: Learn More About CFSD Strategic Plan

span.strong: How will CFSD prepare your child to soar?

div.p: With kids watching, more animals choose wildlife bridge to commute across Oracle Road. A growing number of wild animals are enjoying the benefits of two wildlife crossings on North Oracle Road near Catalina State Park. Since 2016, remote cameras have recorded roughly 10,000 animals from at least 19 species using the specially designed bridge and tunnel across the divided, six-lane road. At least some of those animals were identified with the help of fourth-grade students from the Catalina Foothills School District.

br.br: Congratulations to Foothills grad Micaela Martinez '08, who is making her Broadway debut as Singer Swing in WICKED at the Gershwin Theatre.

a.span: Learn More About the CFSD Alumni Program

div.p: The ECMS 7th grade boys basketball team won a state championship.
The ECMS 8th grade boys basketball team made it to the fourth round in state play.
The high school DECA team competed in the DECA State Career Development Conference.
Both the Esperero and Orange Grove Science Olympiad teams will advance to the state championship.
CFHS's marching band won the Paul Grimes Performance Award at the 2020 Tucson Rodeo Parade.
CFHS Winterguard won 1st place in their division at the WGAZ Guard Focus Competition.
The high school Speech & Debate team competed at state with several wins.
City Shaders, Orange Grove's FFL team, have been selected to participate in the LEGOLAND Open Invitational.
The CFHS Pioneer 327 won the Motivate Award.

span.strong: What is the District’s Open Enrollment Program?

div.p: Open enrollment is a state law that allows students to attend schools outside of their resident school if the receiving school has the capacity to accept them. CFSD residents who wish to attend a school other than their home area school must apply under the open enrollment program as well as non-resident families.
